Episodes.Title: It's a Black President, Huey Freeman
Episodes.Plot: The Freemans are filmed for a German documentary about the 2008 election of Barack Obama in the Season 3 premiere.

Episodes.Title: Bitches to Rags
Episodes.Plot: When his new album tanks, Thugnificent is faced with the horror of getting a real job.

Episodes.Title: The Red Ball
Episodes.Plot: Kickball legend Huey Freeman returns after a self-imposed exile from the game.

Episodes.Title: The Story of Jimmy Rebel
Episodes.Plot: Uncle Ruckus has long idolized Jimmy Rebel, a popular racist country singer based on the infamous Johnny Reb, a.k.a. Pee Wee Trahan. So much did Jimmy Rebel's music influence him that he eventually sends off recordings of his own racist tunes to the man, and is faced with a dilemma when Jimmy shows up on his doorstep.  Uncle Ruckus' legendary status as a black-hating racist thus runs up against the slight problem of his negritude.

Episodes.Title: Stinkmeaner 3: The Hateocracy
Episodes.Plot: The Freemans are in trouble when Stinkmeaner's gang decide to come after them in retaliation for his death

Episodes.Title: Smokin With Cigarettes
Episodes.Plot:
When Riley befriends juvenile felon Lamilton Taeshawn, he is having the best time of his life as they go around, causing trouble. Things take a turn for the worst when Lamilton wants to cause more than just trouble when he shows Riley a real handgun...

A parody of the now infamous web video where the little boy steals his grandma's Durango and goes joy riding after she refuses to buy him chicken wings at the grocery store.

Episodes.Title: The Fundraiser
Episodes.Plot: Riley organizes a fundraiser with Cindy McPhearson and other kids from Woodcrest.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Offensive language and content that may disturb.

Episodes.Title: Pause
Episodes.Plot: Granddad is cast as the leading man by mega-superstar of stage and screen, Winston Jerome. But when the theater group turns out to be a homoerotic evangelical cult, it's up to Huey and Riley to put a pause to it.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Offensive language and content that may disturb.

Episodes.Title: A Date With the Booty Warrior
Episodes.Plot: Having conquered his fear of prison rape, Tom volunteers to lead Huey, Riley, and some classmates on a trip to jail as part of a Scared Stiff program. But when a riot breaks out, Tom has to get the kids, and his delicate backside, out of jail in one piece.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Offensive language and content that may disturb.

Episodes.Title: The Story of Lando Freeman
Episodes.Plot: There's a new handyman in the neighborhood undercutting Uncle Ruckus... which is all good for Granddad and his garden until the man claims to be his long lost son, Lando. Will Granddad take responsibility and be a father to his child? Not without a talk show paternity test.
Episodes.ParentalRatingReason: Offensive language and content that may disturb.
Episodes.GuestStars: Samuel L. Jackson, Billy Dee Williams, John DiMaggio

Episodes.Title: Lovely Ebony Brown
Episodes.Plot: Grandad meets a young black woman who asks him out on a date, and the only person who can spoil Grandad's new romance, is Grandad.

Episodes.Title: Mr. Medicinal
Episodes.Plot: After a checkup, a doctor warns Granddad that he could die any day if he doesn't get his stress levels down. Not wanting to become dependent on pills, he decides to take Thugnificent's suggestion and turns to marijuana.

Episodes.Title: The Kentucky Fried Flu
Episodes.Plot: When a chicken franchise run out of its newest recipe introduction, things go from bad to worse when a viral outbreak is linked to the same chicken. Thankfully, Huey has prepared a survival outline in just such an emergency, but it's all threatened when no one can seem to stick to the simple plan.

Episodes.Title: The Color Ruckus
Episodes.Plot: On a final visit to Woodcrest, Ruckus's terminally ill Nana wants to die in Robert Freeman's house.

Episodes.Title: It's Goin Down
Episodes.Plot: A terror attack near Woodcrest is imminent, and retired domestic terrorist Huey Freeman is the main suspect. With super-agent Jack Flowers on his tail and Ed and Rummy on the loose, can anyone save the day?
Episodes.GuestStars: Charlie Murphy, Samuel L. Jackson, Edward Asner, John C. McGinley, Louis Lombardi
